translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Downfall
Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Blessed One was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṁ jetavanaṁ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta vaṇṇā kevala kappam jetavanam obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: Then, as the night was passing away, a certain deity, lighting up the whole of Jeta’s Grove with his surpassing beauty, approached the Blessed One, and stood on one side after saluting him.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:🔽“Parābhavantaṁ purisaṁ,
analyzed: ekamantam ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantam gāthāya ajjhabhāsi  parābhavantam purisa
translated: And as she thus stood on one side, the deity addressed the Blessed One with a verse:
“We ask you, Gotama, about the man who is down and out,
Having come to ask you, Blessed One,
what is the cause of his downfall?”
“The man who is well-known,
is the one who is down and out.
He who loves the Dhamma,
is the one who teaches the Dhamma to the down and out.”
“So we understand this,
that this is the first cause of downfall.
Tell us the second, Blessed One,
what is the cause of downfall?”
“The man who is not good,
loves the good, but does not do good.
He delights in unwholesome things,
That is the gateway to downfall.”
“Thus we know this,
That is the second downfall.
Please tell us the third,
What is the gateway to downfall?”
“One who is addicted to sleep, addicted to assemblies,
A person who does not rise up,
Lazy, with anger and conceit,
That is the gateway to downfall.”
“Thus we know this,
That is the third downfall.
Please tell us the fourth,
What is the gateway to downfall?”

analyzed: yaḥ mātaram pitaram vā  jiṇṇakam gata yobbana

“Thus we know this,
That is the fourth downfall.
Please tell us the fifth,
What is the gateway to downfall?”
“One who deceives a brahmin or ascetic,
Or any other merchant,
With false speech,
That is the gateway to downfall.”
“Thus we know this,
That is the fifth downfall.
Please tell us the sixth,
What is the gateway to downfall?”

that is the seventh gateway to decline.

who destroys what he has gained,
that is a gateway to decline.”
“Thus we know this,
that is the eighth gateway to decline.
Please tell us the ninth,

that is a gateway to decline.”
“Thus we know this,
that is the ninth gateway to decline.
Please tell me the tenth,
What is the gateway to downfall?”
“A man past his youth
Who takes a young wife
Who doesn’t sleep because of jealousy:
That’s a gateway to downfall.”
“So we understand this,
That’s the tenth downfall.
Please tell me the eleventh,
What is the gateway to downfall?”

analyzed: itthim soṇḍim vikiraṇi  purisam vā api tādisa
translated: “A woman or a man who’s greedy and wasteful
Appoints someone to a position of authority.
That’s a gateway to downfall.”
“So we understand this,
That’s the eleventh downfall.
Please tell me the twelfth,
What is the gateway to downfall?”
“One of little wealth with great desire
Is born into a noble family.
And he aspires to kingship:
That’s a gateway to downfall.🔽The wise one, having considered
The downfalls in the world,
The noble one endowed with vision
Will find happiness in the world.”
The sixth chapter on downfalls is finished.
